title: Jordan Baldwinson
text:
Jordan Baldwindson (born 11 October 1994) is an English professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who plays as a or for the <a href="Bradford%20Bulls">Bradford Bulls</a> in the <a href="RFL%20Championship">RFL Championship</a>.
He played for the <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds Rhinos</a> in the <a href="Super%20League">Super League</a>. Baldwinson was contracted to the <a href="New%20Zealand%20Warriors">New Zealand Warriors</a> in the <a href="NRL">NRL</a>, and spent time on loan from the <a href="New%20Zealand%20Warriors">Warriors</a> at the <a href="Bradford%20Bulls">Bradford Bulls</a> in the Super League. He spent a season at <a href="Featherstone%20Rovers">Featherstone Rovers</a> in the <a href="Betfred%20Championship">Championship</a>, before returning to <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds</a> in the top flight, whilst spending time back at <a href="Featherstone%20Rovers">Featherstone</a> on loan in the second tier. Baldwinson has also played for <a href="Wakefield%20Trinity">Wakefield Trinity</a> in the Super League, and on loan from <a href="Wakefield%20Trinity">Wakefield</a> at the <a href="Leigh%20Centurions">Leigh Centurions</a>, <a href="Halifax%20RLFC">Halifax</a> and <a href="York%20City%20Knights">York</a> in the Championship.
Background.
Baldwinson was born in <a href="Leeds">Leeds</a>, West Yorkshire, England. He was brought up in Beeston, Leeds and attended Cockburn High School in Leeds.
Career.
Leeds Rhinos.
Baldwinson made his début in 2013 against <a href="Widnes%20Vikings">Widnes Vikings</a> in Round 4. His next appearance would be in Round 19 against <a href="Huddersfield%20Giants">Huddersfield Giants</a>. At the end of the season it was announced he had signed a 2-year deal with <a href="New%20Zealand%20Warriors">New Zealand Warriors</a> after making only 2 appearances for Leeds.
New Zealand Warriors.
Baldwinson signed a two-year deal with <a href="NRL">NRL</a> side <a href="New%20Zealand%20Warriors">New Zealand Warriors</a>, and started out in the Under 20 reserve grade.
Bradford Bulls.
Halfway through the 2014 season he returned to England on loan with <a href="Bradford%20Bulls">Bradford Bulls</a> making his début against <a href="Catalans%20Dragons">Catalans Dragons</a>. He went on to make 5 appearances for the Bulls in 2015 before being released by <a href="New%20Zealand%20Warriors">New Zealand Warriors</a> at the end of the season.
Featherstone Rovers.
In 2015 Baldwinson signed a one-year deal with <a href="Championship%20%28rugby%20league%29">Championship</a> side <a href="Featherstone%20Rovers">Featherstone Rovers</a> in their bid to earn promotion to <a href="Super%20League">Super League</a>. Featherstone finished the season 5th just outside Qualifiers, ending their hopes of promotion but went on to play in the <a href="Championship%20Shield">Championship Shield</a> where they beat <a href="London%20Broncos">London Broncos</a> in the final. Baldwinson made 31 appearance for Featherstone, scoring one try. He was also named young Championship player of the year.
Leeds Rhinos.
Baldwinson returned to Leeds after signing a new deal to play for them in 2016.
Wakefield Trinity.
In August 2017 Baldwinson signed for Wakefield Trinity on a two-year deal from the start of the 2018 season.
Halifax.
In 2018 Baldwinson played on loan for <a href="Halifax%20RLFC">Halifax</a> in the <a href="Betfred%20Championship">Betfred Championship</a>.
Bradford Bulls.
On 29 Sep 2021 it was reported that he had signed for <a href="Bradford%20Bulls">Bradford Bulls</a> in the <a href="RFL%20Championship">RFL Championship</a>
Honours.
<a href="Championship%20Shield">Championship Shield</a>: 2015
